reviewText: This 4 disc collection of season 1 My Little Pony episodes provides a great trip down memory lane for any child of the 80s but is also a great set for any new millenium child or pre-teen who enjoys ponies, horses, or the G3 (newer released) my little ponies.The box set has art work from the G2 (or second release of the MLP- late 90s) ponies because Hasbro lost the rights to the original MLP (G1- or generation 1- the original MLP characters).  Don't let this fool you, however. The 4 disc multi episode collection features the beloved pegasus winged ponies, unicorns, spike the dragon, the bushwollies, as well as megan and the other Earth ponies.The episodes have a more developed plot than the newer G3 (current movies) as well as ponies and vilians with more complex personalities and personas.  Re-watching the episodes as an adult, it is fasanating to observe the many morales and complex issues that some of the ponies worked through.As a pediatric provider, this is a great highly recommended television viewing boxed set to own and love for the current generation of pony fans or an adult with a little girl's heart and mind trapped inside.
summary: My Little Pony I love the 80s revisited

reviewText: I watched this show when it first aired. Before I purchase the DVD set, can anyone who has already bought it recall if the opening theme song is the original?If I can recall correctly, I think it begins like this: "Come to where the magic is. Where the rainbow ends. Follow, follow My Little Pony. My Little Pony and friends. Through the clouds and past the stars, where the river bends. Follow, follow My Little Pony, My Little Pony & Friends."Someone out there, I hope you can help. I remember it came on Saturday morning. I think it was on ABC. Another show that came on that same year (1986) was "The Kidsongs TV Show" which I used to really like.

reviewText: I am SOOO glad this came to DVD! I had to buy it the MINUTE it came out! It has all the episodes from the first season! The animation looks great. A heck of a lot better than on some of my tapes of MLP.The only complaint I have is about the two "pilot" episodes, "Rescue at Midnight Castle" and "Escape from Catrina." These were originally television specials. In 1986, the Powers That Be edited them as episodes of the MLP TV series. The versions on the DVD are the edited TV show versions.But even with the edited specials, this DVD set is worth it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you are a fan of My Little Pony you would know that the first episodes weren't so cute and cuddly as Miss "Terrible for small children" wishes it was.  To say that MLP is garbage and frightening is also misleading.  It is about as scary as  He-Man episode!  If your child is frightened by seeing a cartoon beast, than it's probably their upbringing.  It is certainly not a scary cartoon, but did tone down as it became more and more popular.Teaching my kids (and yours) about respecting nature and that life is not always happiness, fun, and pink cotton candy will help them better deal with Life.  If seeing the "bad guy" on a cartoon freaks a kid out, then maybe LIFE is too harsh for them.
summary: Terrible for small children? . . . NO WAY
Title: N/A

reviewText: My Little Pony was my favorite show when I was a kid, and this DVD has all of my favorite 'old school' episodes. (this is from the '80s). It includes The Revolt of Paradise Estate, Ghost of Paradise Estate, Tambelon (which scared the heck out of me has a kid), and Crunch the Rock Dog, plus some that I had never seen.This DVD also includes the original pilot episode with Scorpan and the Rainbow of Darkness (my memory of this episode was the pulsing bag which was the rainbow of darkness and the four ponies being changed into demonic dragon looking things) and Escape from Katrina (where the bushwoolies were slaves creating witchbrew for a giant witch cat). These two episodes are earlier animation (Megan is more anime looking and the 'hero' ponies are Posey, Firefly, AppleJack, Baby Moondancer and Sundance...instead of Paradise, Fizzy, Wind Whistler (my fav!), Shady, Ribbon, Gusty and Sweet Stuff of later episodes. Also the animation of the ponies is a little different).Sure there are problems with this show...including the fact that the animation is pretty terrible at times (voices don't match the character speaking or a voice is heard when no one's mouth is moving) but for me this is all about the memories from my childhood and I was thrilled to find all of favorite TV show episodes in one place. A definate must for any old school MLP fan.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This box set is great for the 2 pilot episodes featured on the 4th disc. The rest of the episodes, for some reason, werent nicely animated like the 2 episodes, and the storylines were kinda crappy as well. Both pilot episodes, which were separately released on vhs in the 80's, I've seen go up over $40 each on eBay, because they became "out of print". Well now's your chance to own both episodes, along with many others, beautifully restored, at a pretty fair price, so go out and get this, and you too will be singing, "Shooby-by-do-Shoo-Shoo-by do!"

reviewText: It's about time someone got around to putting out these wonderful cartoons. They are not as violence as the ones they have now, like powerrangers, nor do they condone violence. That's what I love most about MLP and the old Scooby Doo shows. Whoever says My Little Ponies is violent needs a serious reality check. I wish they would put more My Little Ponies on tape. Can't wait to show this to my neices and cousins. Not to mention I can't wait to watch the rest of the episodes. I'm a child of the 80's and love all those shows. Still watch them now that I am 30. Keep up the good work and thanks for putting out the DVDs.

reviewText: I have to say, that even at my age, going back and watching these shows was really fun! It was nice to see that the themes and plots weren't all about combing hair and going to a beauty pagent. These stories had many excellent themes and for the most part they were very enjoyable.I found several elements, such as the bushwoolies, incredibly annoying and I think the series could have done without. However, for the most part, all the episodes were very entertaining and sometimes unpredictable.Rescue at moonlight Castle (?) and Escape from Catrina, the two bonus movies were the best by far, and I really liked the voice overs.THis series is really perfect for younger children, because it does deal with good vs evil in a very unfrightening way. THough I am a G2 fan myself, it was very fun and exciting to go back and watch the ponies come alive. I hope to show these to my own children (particularly the girls) someday!

reviewText: I was very disappointed that there was a song missing on Escape from Katrina (which shows how Katrina and Rex were once good and not evil).  At least they had two of my favorite songs on their though (Let's Not Take a Nap and Dress Like a Dream).  I rate this DVD 4 stars because the way the DVD's are packaged in the DVD's look unprofessional and the fact that there's a song missing on Escape from Katrina, which is like the best special/episode in the world!!  But it's a must have if you have a little girl and you grew up with MLP :)  It'll bring back so many memories :)
summary: Missing Song on Escape From Katrina

reviewText: I was thrilled when I found this DVD set because my daughter (currently 12), LOVES MLP but mostly focused on the new G3 stuff. She had a few G1 and G2 ponies in her collection (thanks to my hunting them down online), but once she saw this DVD set, she has now taken to G1 ponies big time (and might I add, she magically zeros in on the hardest ones to find and the most expensive!).I was amazed by how well done these 1980s stories are. They are well written and engaging even for adults. I find them much more fun and well thought out than the DVDs they put out today for G3 ponies.Oh, and I love the occasional sound of a light sabre tossed in for good measure, too! Listen for that during action scenes on some episodes.I think the one thing my daughter and I love most about this series are the Bushwoolies. They are so CUTE! My daughter also has begun to prefer vintage Spike the dragon to the newer one seen in the Princess Prominade. She also likes Megan and her siblings very much. So far, the new series are made up of all ponies where these shows have a huge variety of characters both human and supernatural and lots of creatures of different types including the Sea Ponies.All in all, I think the original MLP is much better and much more entertaining and now my daughter is liking them even more than the new stuff, too.Any MLP fan should have these DVDs in this collection.

reviewText: I have been a 'My Little Pony' fan since the first series of toys. I am 26 now, so I grew up in the 80's with all the cool toys, cartoons, and games. I *still* collect MLPs today and have been buying many of the newest series of toys and DVDs.So, naturally, I was thrilled with the release of the original MLP cartoons on a DVD set. I did not remember the cartoon series much, except for the 2 specials which I always loved and still have on recorded VHS, so those were fresh in my mind.When buying the DVD set, I assumed that the whole series was similar to the 2 specials episodes. Boy was I wrong!The 2 specials, "Rescue at Midnight Castle" (the pilot episode) and "Escape from Katrina" had great storylines with alot of Adventure and enemies without being overly violent for kids, yet still dark enough for even boys to be able to enjoy watching. The animation was well done, the characters were well drawn, the voices fit the characters perfectly, and even the songs were good (thats coming from someone who hates singing in cartoons)!The rest of the series had a different, more 'overly-cutesy' art style, some of the voices got on my nerves, and the songs in each episode were horrid. The storylines were very uncreative and enemies were just dumb and annoying (ugh those irritating witches in End of Flutter Valley, and that annoying pig in glass princess.... The enemy characters were awesome in the 2 specials)Now the worst part is... the only 2 good episodes (the specials of course) were edited versions!!! Scenes and cute songs were cut out of these great episodes yet the rest of the series seems to be intact.So I can't even make use of the DVD set to enjoy my 2 favorite, genuinely good, episodes of MLP. Thnakfully I still have the recorded-from-TV VHS tape to watch those in their full glory!And what were they thinking with the box-art? Those aren't even true MLPs on the box. Those are crummy cartoon-drawings of that horrible series of MLP toys released sometime in the late-90's I think it was... wasn't even by Hasbro. Just some cheap looking, scrawny excuses for MLPs. Thankfully Hasbro makes the new series again.I gave as many as 2 stars mainly for the fond memories. I still love MLP, and the DVD set is a worthy addition to serious fans/collectors of MLP who want to at least have that box of memories on their shelf.There was *some* cute parts here and there, but overall it wasn't very good at all. They really should have made the whole series with the same art-style, voices, and interesting storylines as the 2 specials.There are plenty of DVD sets of old cartoons I have been buying (Thundercats, Ducktales, Mario, Zelda, etc.) and I still enjoy them as much as I remember as a kid.I wish I could say the same about My Little Pony. Ah well. MLP is still my favorite 80's toy at least :)They are getting better with the newer cartoons actually... the first few were corny, but the newest movie (Princess Promenade) is actually quite good so far (just bought it today and watching it now. My only problem is that they ruined 'Spike' the dragon...). Minty Christmas was also pretty cute. But they are getting increasingly better it seems.
Title: N/A
